channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chicago Suburb Plans to Acquire Pope Leo XIV’s Childhood Home
item.description: The village of Dolton, Ill., has stepped in to buy the modest house where Pope Leo XIV spent some of his childhood. It may also use eminent domain.

item.title: Bitcoin touches all-time high and Treasury yields cross 5% again
item.description: Bitcoin soared to record levels before dropping like a stone later in the day. U.S. equities saw their positive streak cut short.

item.title: The Trump administration just proposed its first animal to be added to the endangered species list: a rare fish from Nevada that’s ‘barely clinging to existence’
item.description: At the same time, the Trump administration has been trying to eliminate habitat protections for endangered and threatened species.

item.title: Judge Finds Trump Administration Violated Court Order With Deportation Flight to South Sudan
item.description: Lawyers for some of the eight migrants deported Tuesday said they were told they were being sent to South Sudan. People familiar with the plane said i...

item.title: Graduates Boo Columbia’s President at Commencement After a Fraught Year
item.description: Claire Shipman, the university’s acting president, noted the absence of Mahmoud Khalil, a graduate who continues to be detained by immigration authori...

item.title: Freddy Lim, Frontman of Chthonic, Is Taiwan’s New Envoy to Finland
item.description: Freddy Lim, the founder and lead singer of Chthonic, is well known in Finland, a heavy metal capital of the world.

item.title: With Elon Musk in attendance, South Africa’s president counters Trump for pushing a baseless conspiracy theory about ‘white genocide’: ‘This I’ve never seen’
item.description: Musk's Grok AI was recently caught referencing the same "white genocide" conspiracy theory, unprompted, to unrelated user questions.

item.title: Andy Jassy makes the case for Amazon’s extraordinary AI spending, promising shareholders they will end up ‘very happy’
item.description: Amazon's annual shareholder meeting lacked surprises, but provided the CEO with another chance to build faith in his AI spending.

item.title: Vitamin D supplements may slow down your biological clock, new study finds
item.description: A deeper look at how Vitamin D could protect against age-related decline.

item.title: India’s Security Forces Kill Dozens in a Bid to Crush Leftist Rebels
item.description: Military operations have intensified in recent weeks as the government has set a deadline of next year to defeat a decades-old Maoist insurgency.

item.title: Republican Bill Could Set Off Global Tax Fight
item.description: Retaliatory taxes on foreign companies operating in the U.S. could open the door for a broader economic conflict.

item.title: Trump Ambushes South African President Ramaphosa With Claims of Genocide: What to Know
item.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa pushed back on Mr. Trump’s allegations.

item.title: Freddy Lim, Frontman of Chthonic, Is Taiwan’s New Envoy to Finland
item.description: Freddy Lim, the founder and lead singer of Chthonic, is well known in Finland, a heavy metal capital of the world.

item.title: Kid Cudi Will Testify in Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Sex-Trafficking Trial
item.description: In an effort to present Mr. Combs as the leader of a criminal enterprise, an investigator testified about the drugs, guns and other items found in his...

item.title: A Climate Law, You Say? Never Heard of It.
item.description: The Inflation Reduction Act was once hailed as the biggest climate law in U.S. history. But as supporters try to save it, they’ve stopped talking abou...
